original_title: Decision on IMF bailout package for Sri Lanka, today
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Executive Board of the International Monetary Board will meet on Monday (20) to discuss the IMF-supported program for Sri Lanka.

On 7th March IMF Executive Director Kristalina Georgieva said Sri Lankan authorites have made progress in taking decisive policy action, and have obtained financing assurances from all their major creditors including China, India, Japan, and the Paris Club.
The IMF board will hold a meeting on March 20th for the consideration of approval for an Extended Fund Facility of a $2.9 billion bailout package for the country.
Sri Lanka started the related negotiations with the international lender in 2022 after the South Asian country was hit by a severe economic crisis.
